comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Wow, it was in bits in 1990! Looks much better in Streetview today.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] It certainly does, Niall! Little eaves/attic windows in the roof too...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Within walking distance of Foynes Flying Boat Museum. www.flyingboatmuseum.com The tail of the Boeing B314 replica is visible. Street View

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Foynes, Askayton, Tarbert and Glin!  the four manest towns that I ever was in!!! A friend from Clare was fond of reciting that line to my friend from Askeaton and myself.  It was not my experience though, I always loved the three Limerick towns in any event.  The Shannon is majestic down around there and the scenery is worth the trip!

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: The whole country was in bits in 1990. When I came back in the late '90s after living abroad for four years I didn't know the place and the change between then and now has been massive too. Tempus fugit, eh?
